intro: Buchia plantaginea, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-30 cm and thrives in warm, humid environments. It prefers well-draining soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its compact size and vibrant blooms make it a favored ornamental plant worldwide.
